title: Supercopa de España Femenina
text:
The Supercopa de España Femenina or the "Spanish Women's Super Cup" is a <a href="super%20cup">super cup</a> tournament in <a href="Football%20in%20Spain">Spanish football</a>, contested by the winners and runners up of the <a href="Copa%20de%20la%20Reina%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol">Copa de la Reina</a> and the remaining highest ranked teams from the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20%28women%29">Primera División</a> that had not already qualified through the cup final.
History.
From 1997 to 2000, four editions of the Supercopa were played between the winners of the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20%28women%29">League</a> and the <a href="Copa%20de%20la%20Reina%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol">Copa de la Reina</a>, with <a href="Levante%20UD%20%28women%29">San Vicente CFF</a> winning its first edition, <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20M%C3%A1laga">Atlético Málaga</a> the second one, <a href="Eibartarrak%20FT">Eibartarrak FT</a> achieving the third edition and Levante (after absorbing San Vicente) winning the last one.
The competition was re-instated in December 2019 by the <a href="Royal%20Spanish%20Football%20Federation">Royal Spanish Football Federation</a> with the same format as the established for the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a">2019–20 men's tournament</a>.
